game module

class game.Game(screen)[source]

Bases: object

The main game controller class that manages the game loop, game state, player, enemies, projectiles, camera, and rendering.

general_view

If True, shows the entire map instead of the viewport.

Type:

bool

screen

The main screen surface for rendering.

Type:

pygame.Surface

clock

Clock object to manage frame rate.

Type:

pygame.time.Clock

running

Controls the main loop execution.

Type:

bool

current_time

Current game time in milliseconds.

Type:

int

map

The current game map.

Type:

Map

level

The current level structure containing multiple floors.

Type:

Level

current_floor

Index of the currently active floor.

Type:

int

player

The player entity.

Type:

Player

enemies

List of enemy entities on the current floor.

Type:

list

projectiles

List of active projectiles in the game.

Type:

list

camera

Camera that defines the current view window.

Type:

Camera

debug_mode

If True, renders debug information.

Type:

bool

debug_renderer

Utility to show debug data on the screen.

Type:

DebugRenderer

__init__(screen)[source]

Initialize the Game class.

Parameters:

screen (pygame.Surface) – The main surface to draw the game on.

handle_events()[source]

Handle input events such as quit requests.

on_action()[source]

Handle special action input, such as transitioning to the next floor.

on_game_end()[source]

Handle logic for when the game ends.

render()[source]

Render the current game state including the map, player, enemies, projectiles, and optionally debug info.

run()[source]

Render the current game state including the map, player, enemies, projectiles, and optionally debug info.

setup(level, game_map)[source]

Set up the initial game state with the given level and map.

Parameters:

  • level (Level) – The level object containing floor data and entities.

  • game_map (Map) – The map layout for rendering and collision.

update()[source]

Update the game state, including player, enemies, projectiles, and debug information.
